documents.document: Interesting. Also, why doesn't the article mention technique is called Jin Shin Jyutsu self-care? https://t.co/kWR0goFEew
.@broadwaybabyto personally, I prefer to meditate alone. I'm just not a group meditator
I think @broadwaybabyto that there are often multiple factors, and ppl can be a huge one
Actually, clicked more like 5 yrs ago @broadwaybabyto I didn't come to it easily, 1st teacher said 'don't have 2 like it, just have 2 do it'
.@broadwaybabyto it's only in the last few years that it has 'clicked ' with me. Used to just do it because I had to
.@broadwaybabyto I started as part of my treatment for a major depressive episode (not the last one, the one b4) and I hated it
Heh, @broadwaybabyto, I've been meditating for more than 8 yrs, I've just gone public more recently ;)
Poorly. I think my answer to this question is clearly that I do it poorly. https://t.co/roX5ylpSWx
Good advice. Why do we hold ourselves to higher standards? https://t.co/nxHJrJ1sJ2
particularly struck home for me, bc during these awful times my #selfcare has really slipped. Audre Lorde reminded me of its importance
"Caring for myself is not self-indulgence, it is self-preservation, and that is an act of political warfare." Audre Lorde NB 2 remember now
Okay, I'm gonna start putting quotes I like up on twitter. Just so everyone is forewarned. ;)
But ohhhh sometimes that self-compassion is so hard... https://t.co/kiiHkFUYla
Yes! I have lived for many years by a mantra of sorts "blame is futile" so this really resonates with me https://t.co/JN0IpMsTHM
The headline reads "Every year, Canadian police dismiss 1 out of every 5 sexual assault allegations as baseless"… https://t.co/DrQPD3QbCv
Let's all just take a moment and appreciate how wonderful @kady is. Really really wonderful. Also, it means I don't have to watch the debate
Loving kindness #meditation is kind of my go-to these days, and look, science says that's good! https://t.co/MfPMaaPtBk
Oh @gcharlebois, I was so soothed by a giant Paul Simon playlist on Spotify a while ago, I had been away too long (it had some S&G on it)
I think I have let #Mindfulness practise go a bit in the recent horrific events, when I probably need it most. Don't forget #selfcare
Realization came as I read a tweet where @mindfuleveryday quoted me from a while ago. I guess I shld listen to myself, eh? ;)
Realized this morning I am *trying* to not think while #meditating to get back on track & that is probably the opposite of what I need to do
I am reminded lately that my journey with #meditation not linear. Was doing so well focusing for a while, now I'm #thoughts central
@monicarooney yeah, I'm fine. It was yesterday, so I'm still in a reasonable amount of pain, but it's all over now, so uphill from here!
.@monicarooney I was planning to, but am recovering from minor surgery and don't think I can. My mum and John are taking the boys tho
.@monicarooney yeah, there isn't a way to download it, and no external page. :( But it starts at the consulate then heads south
The best I can do for a link is https://t.co/cyd8P22wVM"ref"%3A"3"%2C"action_history"%3A"null"%7D&aref=3&ref=bookmarks
Ppl in Toronto going to the protest at the US consulate Sat: seems it is now a march - saw map posted on FB event page
.@monicarooney it was just on the event page on FB
.@monicarooney it's an actual March apparently. I saw the route posted, I was surprised, I thought it was just at the consulate
Take a moment to read this thread https://t.co/jMqYBzwWZD
@magicalmudge I feel like I missed the memo that it was mollusk day

Okay, time for me to step away and take some deep breaths. Then write some more letters. Take care of yourselves out there folks.
@snobiwan Yeah, I can usually go 'well, a person with no values could twist it this way...' but I am at a loss here
